prompt: Describe the complete process of designing and analyzing a simple resistive circuit (e.g., series-parallel). Include how an engineer identifies the output requirements, selects components, performs calculations, creates circuit diagrams, and ensures the solution meets specifications.

criteria.name: Problem Identification and Output Specification
criteria.description: Defines the electrical problem clearly, including voltage/current needs and functional requirements.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Precisely defines requirements with context and output targets.
performance_descriptors.good: Defines major requirements with minor omissions.
performance_descriptors.average: Mentions general needs with limited specificity.
performance_descriptors.needs_improvement: Unclear or incomplete description of output requirements.
performance_descriptors.poor: Fails to identify core requirements or design goals.

criteria.name: Component Selection and Circuit Calculation
criteria.description: Selects appropriate resistors and calculates circuit behavior accurately.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Accurate calculations with proper component values and clear rationale.
performance_descriptors.good: Correct calculations and mostly appropriate components.
performance_descriptors.average: Some calculation errors or vague component selection.
performance_descriptors.needs_improvement: Minimal or incorrect calculations and vague selection.
performance_descriptors.poor: No evidence of valid calculation or component choice.

criteria.name: Circuit Diagram and Design Presentation
criteria.description: Presents a clear, standard-compliant circuit diagram with labeled elements.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Professional, well-labeled diagram using standard conventions.
performance_descriptors.good: Clear diagram with minor issues in labeling or layout.
performance_descriptors.average: Diagram present but lacks clarity or standard format.
performance_descriptors.needs_improvement: Diagram poorly structured or partially labeled.
performance_descriptors.poor: No diagram or an unusable one.

criteria.name: Design Validation and Communication
criteria.description: Explains how the design is tested and validated against performance specs.

performance_descriptors.excellent: Comprehensively discusses validation using theory and practical checks.
performance_descriptors.poor: No mention of testing or validation.

key_points: Voltage and current needs in a circuit design
Resistors selected for a series-parallel configuration
Formulas used in calculating voltage drops and total resistance
Tools and  softwares used to draw standard circuit diagrams
Verification of circuit performance in implementation
llm_questions: How do engineers define voltage and current needs in a circuit design?
How are resistors selected for a series-parallel configuration?
What formulas are used to calculate voltage drops and total resistance?
What tools or software are used to draw standard circuit diagrams?
How do engineers verify circuit performance before implementation?
